descriptions:
The response does not describe how heavy metals in nearby rivers could affect predators at the top of the food chain, such as any of the following:

· Heavy metals cannot be broken down, so they can bioaccumulate in predators’ tissues.

· Heavy metals biomagnify up the food chain, so top predators could have very high levels of the metals in their bodies.

· Heavy metals can magnify and/or accumulate in top predators to a toxic level that can have sublethal impacts (such as behavioral or physiological effects) or can lead to death.

· Heavy metals can lead to developmental abnormalities in the offspring of top predators.
